intro: Campanula dinarica, commonly known as the Dinaric bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Dinaric Alps. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Campanula dinarica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
